content.headline: Understanding Common Newborn Health Issues: Birth Injuries and Care
content.intro: Many newborns experience minor health concerns and birth injuries that, while often alarming to parents, are typically temporary and resolve without intervention.

sections.title: Common Birth Injuries and Their Causes
sections.content: Several factors can predispose infants to birth injuries:
points: Maternal factors: Prolonged labor, preterm/postterm delivery
Fetal factors: Macrosomia, multiple gestation, abnormal presentation
Obstetric factors: Forceps delivery, vacuum extraction, cesarean birth
Monitoring procedures: Fetal scalp monitoring during labor
Often multiple factors combine to increase injury risk

sections.title: Head and Scalp Injuries
sections.content: The most common birth injuries involve the head and scalp during delivery:
points: Caput Succedaneum: Soft swelling that crosses suture lines, resolves in days
Cephalohematoma: Bleeding between skull and periosteum
Subgaleal Hemorrhage: Serious bleeding into scalp compartment
Skull Fractures: Rare, usually linear or depressed type
Most require no treatment and resolve spontaneously

sections.title: When to Seek Medical Attention
points: Signs of infection: Redness, swelling, fever, pus drainage
Neurological changes: Lethargy, seizures, abnormal movements
Feeding problems: Inability to suck or swallow effectively
Persistent symptoms beyond expected resolution time
